definition: topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to win top marks in the imperial examinations

sentences.english: That’s why Wikipedia is an ideal candidate to set the World Heritage List right.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么维基百科被题名列入世界遗产之列。

sentences.english: The paper discusses the connotation of the title of Shishuoxiyu.
sentences.chinese: 本文讨论了《世说新语》题名的内涵。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the National College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝贺您今年高考旗开得胜，金榜题名。

sentences.english: Jinbang title once, like a carp to leap onto the goal.
sentences.chinese: 一朝题名金榜，犹如鲤鱼跃上龙门。

sentences.english: Ones who recite more have more chances to stand out.
sentences.chinese: 只有背得越多，离金榜题名才越进一步。

sentences.english: He succeeded in the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 他在入学考试中金榜题名了。
他给字典题名为“我们的环境”。

sentences.english: The present has been signed by China's President Hu Jintao.
sentences.chinese: 这份礼物由中国国家主席胡景涛题名。

sentences.english: Consider, just for a moment, the title and dedication of the book.
sentences.chinese: 思考一下，本书的题名与献辞。

sentences.english: I'm glad you passed the test.
sentences.chinese: 知道你金榜题名，我很高兴。

definition: to create a work of calligraphy for display in a prominent place (typically, a sign)
interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
to write the title of a book on a label
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
couplet (hung on the columns of a hall)
a record of events inscribed on a tablet
short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
